intro: Oocephalus lacunosus, commonly known as the lace-leaf fern, is a tropical plant characterized by its intricate, delicate fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to Southeast Asia. The plant features finely divided, arching leaves that give it a lacy appearance, hence its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires consistent moisture. Oocephalus lacunosus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and air-purifying properties.
